description.en: Independent work with IR literature in agreement with the instructor.
description.et: Doktoriõppe üliõpilastele mõeldud individuaaltöö erialakirjandusega. Töö toimub kokkuleppel õppejõuga.

objectives.en: This course introduces the students to the current state of IR as a discipline. It discusses the key practical and theoretical concerns that define the discipline, the main theoretical debates, and the key concepts that organise the disciplinary field.
objectives.et: Kursus tutvustab erinevaid rahvusvaheliste suhete teooriad, peamisi teoreetilisi lähtepunkte ning vaidlusküsimusi ning põhimõisteid.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completing the course, the students:
1) understand the disciplinary logic of IR and its evolution since the beginning of the twentieth century;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) mõistab rahvusvaheliste suhete (RS) distsipliini ja selle arengut 20. sajandi algusest peale;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) understand the key dividing lines between the rationalist and constructivist approaches in contemporary IR and brings out its strengths and weaknesses;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) mõistab erinevusi ratsionalistlike ja konstruktivistlike lähenemiste vahel tänapäeva RS teooriates ja toob välja nende tugevusi ja nõrkusi;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) argue how and why IR theories differ in their approach to the key concepts that shape the disciplinary field;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) sünteesib erinevate RS teooriate seisukohti distsipliini põhimõistete suhtes;
4) demonstreerib väga head kriitilise lugemise oskust;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) use scholarly concepts and theories for their research.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) kasutab teaduslikke mõisteid ja teooriaid oma teadustöös.

independent_work.et:
The PhD candidates are expected to prepare to an oral exam, lasting about 30 minutes. The examinees are expected to demonstrate a thorough understanding of the most important theoretical debates and key texts in IR. They should be able to compare and contrast different theoretical approaches in IR, and assess their strengths and weaknesses. The literature list comprises about 1400 pages of text which is divided into eleven thematic sections. Study questions are provided under each section in order to help you prepare for the examination.

Exam consists of two exam questions, not identical to the study questions below. The examinees have 20 minutes to think about/prepare/organize your answer before being examined. The discussion need not be limited to the two exam questions; additional questions can also be asked if necessary. The exam questions are broad questions asking the examinee to synthesize information and to compare, assess and critically examine major theoretical perspectives in IR.

description.et: The examinee is expected to demonstrate a thorough understanding of the most important theoretical debates and key texts in IR, comparison and contrast of different theoretical approaches in IR, and assessment of its strengths and weaknesses.
